questions.question_text: An IS auditor is reviewing an organization’s system development life cycle (SDLC). Which of the following MUST be included in the review?

choices.D: Definition of quality attributes to be associated with the system
choices.A: Ownership of the system quality management plan
choices.C: Validation that system development processes adhere to quality standards
choices.B: Utilization of standards in the system development processes and procedures

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
When reviewing an organization’s System Development Life Cycle (SDLC), an IS auditor must ensure that system development processes follow established quality standards (e.g., ISO 9001, CMMI, ITIL, COBIT)

Selected Answer: C
An IS auditor reviewing an organization’s SDLC must validate that development processes adhere to established quality standards. This involves verifying compliance with documented procedures at each phase of the lifecycle, such as design specifications, testing protocols, and post-implementation controls12. For example, auditors assess whether design documents align with institutional standards, whether testing follows approved methodologies, and whether changes are properly authorized13. While utilization of standards (B) is important, the audit’s critical function is validation (C) to ensure actual adherence rather than mere existence of standards. Quality attributes (D) and ownership details (A) are context-dependent considerations rather than universal requirements for every SDLC review.
I am torn between B and C. If someone can explain why one is correct with evidence that would be helpful.

comments.content: Validation that system development processes adhere to quality standards: This is crucial because it ensures that the entire SDLC process is consistently producing high-quality systems. Adherence to quality standards throughout the development process helps in identifying and mitigating issues early, ensuring the final product meets the required quality benchmarks. On the other hand, Utilization of standards in the system focuses on the presence of standards rather than verifying that these standards are actually being followed and implemented correctly.

choices.A: Rolling forward of transactions when a production server fails
choices.B: Ad hoc batch reporting jobs from the replication server

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The architecture’s greatest advantage during business hours lies in balancing transactional and analytical workloads. Ad hoc batch reporting jobs from the replication server (Option B) benefit most significantly, as they can be executed without disrupting the production database, leveraging the up-to-date replica to deliver timely insights. This aligns with daily business needs, ensuring both operational efficiency and analytical capability.

Selected Answer: B
The replication server can handle non-critical processes like reporting, analysis, or data extraction, reducing the load on the production server. Thus, ad hoc batch reporting jobs benefit the most from this replication setup.

Selected Answer: A
I think this is A. The question states during business hours and if a server goes down during business hours you need to transition to a backup or replication server to continue business functions.

questions.question_text: When evaluating the management practices at a third-party organization providing outsourced services, the IS auditor considers relying on an independent auditor's report. The IS auditor would FIRST:

choices.D: determine if recommendations have been implemented.
choices.A: review the objectives of the audit.
choices.C: discuss the report with the independent auditor.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Given that year two centers on updating business processes to implement new ERP functionality, the primary focus of an IS auditor should be on user acceptance testing (UAT). This ensures that the process changes are effectively integrated into the upgraded system and meet the finance department’s operational and control requirements.

questions.question_text: A finance department has a two-year project to upgrade the enterprise resource planning (ERP) system hosting the general ledger. In year one, the system version upgrade will be applied, and in year two, business processes will be updated to implement new system functionality. Which of the following should be the PRIMARY focus of an IS auditor reviewing the second year of the implementation?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Among the options, Option D: Encryption keys are not centrally managed represents the greatest concern for an IS auditor. Decentralized key management introduces substantial vulnerabilities that could compromise the entire DLP strategy, far outweighing the other issues. Monitor mode (Option A) is a temporary and manageable setup, crawlers (Option B) are a strength, and deep packet inspection (Option C) is a necessary feature with manageable risks. In contrast, poor encryption key management directly threatens data security, making it the most critical issue to address in a pre-implementation review.

choices.B: Crawlers are used to discover sensitive data.
choices.A: The tool is implemented in monitor mode rather than block mode.
choices.C: Deep packet inspection opens data packets in transit.
choices.D: Encryption keys are not centrally managed.
